Fields.DialogueText: Hang on, everyone! We're just getting started!
@BATTLE
How are you doing on your end, Hiei?
... I'm fine.
Are you sure? You look a little stressed. Usually, you're pretty stoic.
I just feel a little exposed without my swords.
Oh, you forgot them when we got started out here?
I didn't have a choice. They were  scratched in the last battle, so I put them in for repairs.
Don't worry, they'll be ready for the next fight.
I know, but I don't like being away from them.

Fields.MenuText: Think of this as a good exercise to work around your usual crutches.
Swords aren't the only weapon in your repertoire. I'm confident you'll make do.
I know you'll overcome this challenge, just as you always do.

Fields.DialogueText: Good point. I've gotten into the habit of relying on my swords a lot, so this will help me from getting too stuck in one battle form.
You're right. Even if I can't cut the yokai, I can tear them apart with my bare hands!
You give me too much credit. Nevertheless, I must always strive to grow stronger in service to the Emperor. I cannot allow a minor triviality to dissuade me.
Sorry I was a little depressed. It is unbecoming of a soldier.
That's okay, Hiei. It's normal to get caught up on little things now and then.
Anyway, I'm ready to fight some more. The Funayūrei will not get past us.
These Funayūrei will suffer a great defeat today.
@BATTLE
That will teach you a lesson – I hope. Anyway, good job everyone. Especially you, Hiei.
I just did what was necessary for us to succeed, nothing more.
Still, I get the feeling that you'll get a few drinks on the house for your workout here today.
Actually, I was planning to absent myself from the celebration.
Why? There's plenty of good food and drink.
That is part of the issue. I have no interest in eating.
You don't? I thought that hunger was pretty natural for all of us.
I feel the need for consumption, true. However, for me it is simply raw material to keep me alive, nothing more. And I receive sufficient energy through my regular uptake.
You don't have any favorite foods?
Well, I do enjoy a cup of tea now and then, but I am working to wean myself off such temptations.

Fields.MenuText: You say it like it's a bad thing. It can be fun to enjoy things you like.
Even if it doesn't have a direct use, a meal is still a good way to connect with other people.
Well, how about we make the "then" now?

Fields.DialogueText: It's not simply the act of enjoying yourself, but rather the temptation to continue to do so, over and over.
That is a valid point. A tea ceremony has a way of instilling harmony in its participants.
Your grammar is atrocious. But I understand what you are saying.
Let's leave aside the drinks and food. We can still attend the party.
I suppose. Come on, I'll buy us drinks.
Huh? I thought you said you weren't going to have any.
I said that I was working to wean myself off them. Until then, I can have a few when I feel like it.
Whatever you say.
Hiei, where are you?
I'm over here. Did you want me for something?
Not really. I was going to ask if you wanted to do anything in your spare time, but I see that you are busy.
Quite right, but you're a little off. This is my free time right now.
It is? You seem to be doing the same things you do when you are on duty.
And your point would be?
Well, I'm just not sure it's really free time when you make it into a chore.
I consider every action I take to be an important duty to uphold.
Ugh, I'm not getting through...

Fields.MenuText: Well, if it's what makes you happy, I understand.
I'm just worried that you're not giving yourself any time to relax.
We can't get everything done each day. So it's fine if we let a few things slide as a reward.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō. Many people don't understand that I genuinely enjoy the continual challenge.
But I do find this relaxing! It makes me feel like I am alive, and a part of everything.
I know that it is impossible to be perfect at everything. But choosing to slack off rather than try harder... that sounds defeatist. That's just not who I am.
Sorry to bother you.
That's okay. If you'll excuse me, I'm going to get back to wor– I mean, back to my break.
Mind if I join you?
Are you sure? My regimen is rather tough for the unprepared.
Hey, I'm just spending my free time with someone else who is on break, right?
I suppose so. But our rest is about over – we have Funayūrei approaching.
@BATTLE
Hiei?
Yes?
I just wanted to let you know that we are approaching our deployment zone.
Ah, I thought that might be the case. I had better get up on deck, then.
We're not there quite yet, so don't rush. You still need to get suited up, after all.
Actually, I'm fine fighting like I am now.
Are you sure? Some armor would help protect you better.
It also makes it more likely for me to get hit to start with. This way, I can battle more fluidly like I'm used to.

Fields.MenuText: I was just worried that you might get hurt.
It might be a good idea to acclimate yourself to wearing armor in case it's ever necessary.
If it works for you, that's all right.

Fields.DialogueText: That is a risk, I admit, but I am prepared to give my life if necessary. I just want to make sure I can be as effective as I can be until that point.
Good point. I might have to practice with it on sometime. But right now, it would be a hindrance. I'll save the test until after combat.
Arigatō. I feel freer and stronger with the wind brushing against me.
Okay, so the armor's out, but you have everything else you need, right? Swords?
Yes, I have everything. Let's go.
And just in time. Here they come!
@BATTLE
Watch it, Hiei! You almost snagged me with that fishing line.
I'm terribly sorry. I've never learned how to fish before, so I was trying it out.
Ah, so you can enjoy other hobbies in your free time after all, huh?
Actually, this is good practice – casting the line, I mean. I am considering taking up a flail, but I need to get used to how that sort of weapon functions.
I should have known.
It is kind of nice, though. Very peaceful.
Generally with fishing, that's a bad sign. But whatever floats your boat. What do you plan to do with the fish?
I was thinking of making some traditional sushi.
What type are you planning to make? I hear that the varieties are growing.
Just the simplest of versions. I'm not much into fads. You should care more about the food's nutrition than how you present it.

Fields.MenuText: They say that a good appearance makes a meal taste better.
If everything was bland, though, that would take all the excitement out of life.
On the other hand, it's a good way to test your creativity.

Fields.DialogueText: That's just the placebo effect.
There's the rub. Life is beautiful, but to reach the true beauty of enlightenment, we must let go of those attachments.
I prefer learning things that I can apply to battle, but you might be right.
Well, first things first. I need to catch a fish before I can worry about making the food.
Actually, I think you've got a bite.
Really?
Yeah. You'd better pull it in – and fast. I think that fleet on the horizon isn't friendly.
Our first catch of the day.
@BATTLE
What are you doing, Hiei?
I am gazing up at the clouds as they drift by.
Isn't that a little boring?
Not at all. I am watching them very carefully. I want to be sure I notice any important signs they convey, after all.
Like what? That it will rain?
I meant spiritually. There's always something, if you look hard enough.
Even in random clouds?
Why not? All parts of life are connected, so surely everything has meaning in this world.

Fields.MenuText: The issue I see is determining which meaning is correct. A lot of it can vary depending on your point of view.
This means a lot to you, doesn't it?
If everything has meaning, why specifically focus on the clouds?

Fields.DialogueText: The mistake you are making is assuming that there is a single path to enlightenment. We all have our own ways of comprehending life's mysteries.
It does. I want to reach a greater understanding and find fulfillment.
You have to start somewhere. And besides, the clouds look nice.
So, what can you tell from the clouds, Hiei?
Something bad will happen to someone.
That's not good, especially with these Morganas approaching.
On the other hand, it could be that something bad is about to happen to the yokai.
@BATTLE
Fulfillment of what?
I have yet to figure that out.
Yeah, they do.
Ugh, this rain is getting annoying.
It looks like it will not stop for a while.
Ow! And now it's turning to hail! Ouch!
You'd better go inside, then. You can rest up by a heater.
What about you?
Oh, I'll just keep to my post out here.
But it's even worse for you without your armor.
I'm fine. You don't need to trouble yourself.
Why are you so nonchalant about this? I wouldn't expect you to be happy about this.
I'm not. But it's happening, so there's nothing we can do but live with it.

Fields.MenuText: I guess you're not one to complain.
It's okay to come in since it's so bad. I won't think any less of you.
Just be careful out there.

Fields.DialogueText: Why should I? Doing so would not help my situation and would just make others feel worse. Best to just shoulder the burden.
Yes, but if something were to go wrong, I would regret having slackened. Whether I had permission or not is irrelevant. I refuse to falter in my duties.
There's been worse weather at sea. The tales some of my sisters could tell about our patrols...
Anyway, at least it's back to raining.
So you'll just get hypothermia instead of being battered.
I'm fine. You don't need to worry.
Still, use this.
An umbrella?
You might as well take the necessary equipment for your challenges, right?
Right! Although it can be superfluous. The weather can come and go, and I can accept what comes.
No chance to rest when Morganas burst out of the blue.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Tou! Sha!
Whoa, watch it with those weapons! You almost cut me in half!
Don't worry. I sensed that I would miss you by two full centimeters.
Easy for you to say... You're really good with those swords, aren't you?
Decent, at the least. I have spent my life perfecting the art, finding the best way to cut, and block, and strike. The road is still long, though.
Don't worry. I'm sure you'll master it eventually.
Don't say that.
Why not?
Perfection is but an illusion of chaos. The first step to understanding any art is to acknowledge one's own mortality.

Fields.MenuText: How will we know if nothing can be perfect if we don't try?
Still, I know that you'll be, at the very least, just short of perfect in the end. I believe in you.
Even knowing that, you continue to push yourself forward? Why?

Fields.DialogueText: A clever riddler, you are. I should test you with a koan at some point.
Arigatō. I'll do my best to fulfill your vision of me.
To stay still is not to live, whether by being perfect or not even trying. And so, I continue my quest.
Well, do you think I could learn from you?
I am always willing to teach others the art. But don't get your hopes up. It will take a while to be more than decent with a sword.
Given how you describe yourself as decent, I'm not too worried.
Funny. We'll see if you have the same opinion after the first round of training.
For now, we need to get some target practice in.
And we're in luck! Here come some "volunteer" targets right now.
@BATTLE
It seems that I am getting more than enough target practice today, Captain!
@BATTLE
Good work, everybody. We're almost done – aaagh! What was that explosion?!
The Funayūrei had a new trick up their sleeve. A good third of the fleet is now on fire.
Damn! And we were so close to winning.
Don't worry, the Funayūrei didn't get the last laugh before we got them all wet. Right now, I need to get all of the injured to safety. How are you doing?
I'm fine, just a little shaken. What about you?
Nothing to worry about on my end.
Those burn marks say otherwise.
Just minor damage. Nothing like Nobunaga's brand, I can tell you that much. Besides, the fleet needs me with the recovery efforts.
Are you sure? You can get assistance as well.
Kanchou, there is no time for me to rest, or even cry out in pain, right now. Every moment we pause is time running out for others.

Fields.MenuText: You don't seem to be too disturbed by the fire.
I'm surprised you aren't more eager to chase down the remaining Morganas for a good fight.
Let's all work together to get out of this mess.

Fields.DialogueText: Fire is just another part of the earth. We will overcome it, like all challenges, and be reborn anew.
Rescue operations are equally important to me. I still remember the days after the big quake.
Of course. I tend to fight alone, but it's together that we can truly make a difference.
I'm just glad you're okay.
Show some concern for yourself as well. But thanks for helping me out.
It was my duty and honor to do so.
I guess we'll have to postpone our party for now.
I suppose so. For the moment, let us focus on reaching out to the others. Maybe later we can share a small cup of tea.
What's the matter, Hiei? You're pacing back and forth all over the place.
I'm not worried about anything. If I was, I would be going clockwise, not counter.
Even so, you keep eyeing the water uneasily. What's wrong?
It's just... with this weather, I'm worried about the UBs.
You think there's a sub in the area? And wouldn't they hesitate to shoot their ally?
Not U-boats. I meant Umibozu – a sea yokai.
You're all worked up about sea monsters of all things?
They are a serious threat to fishermen who sail too far out. And with everything going on, the spirits are probably restless.
Calm down. There's no need to panic.
I am not panicking. I am simply taking the necessary precautions.
I'm not sure making sealing tags and cutting the lids off our barrels is the right sort of precaution.
You never know. Could you give me a hand with this, please?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe the yokai will focus on the Morganas instead of us.
Is there anything we can do to ward off these Umibozu?
You shouldn't worry about things that may not even exist.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm, you might be right. Yokai often symbolize nature's wrath, and the Funayūrei haven't exactly been the most charitable towards the environments they've visited.
We might get off safely if we pass them bottomless barrels. Hence my current efforts.
Just because our vision is limited does not mean things are nonexistent. I have great faith in the powers of the yokai. After all, the Funayūrei and I are living proof.
Okay, I'll leave you to your work, but I really think you're getting worked up over nothing.
*ALARM*
I rest my case.
Those are Morganas, not Umibozu.
One aquatic yokai, another sea yokai, not much difference. In any case, I'm ready to fight.
@BATTLE
I see...
What are you writing there, Hiei?
I am sending a report on our work back to Tokyo and the Emperor.
Ah, I see. You must really like keeping them updated. I saw you making another report just the other day.
It's important that they know what progress we are making, so they can plan our larger strategy accordingly.
They must be proud of all the work you're doing out here.
I have received some praise, true, but I focus on the facts of the engagements. I am but a cog in a larger network of soldiers.
Still, you seem to send a message after every battle. Isn't that a little over the top?
I guess. I just want to make them as happy as I can.
You must really love your country.
I do! They have looked after me for so long, even when I was supposed to be dismantled, and they continue to help me grow stronger. I am honored to serve and die for the homeland.

Fields.MenuText: Just don't get too fatalistic. They can also use you after the war is over.
What do you think about some of the incidents that have become notorious?
It's good to see that you get along well with your home country.

Fields.DialogueText: You have a point there. I've worked during peacetime before, so there's a lot I could do to help. I just mean that if I have to give my life to save Japan, I'll do it.
Like the ones in China? They're... dishonorable, but those are just individual incidents. I still keep to the code of a samurai and monk.
Agreed, it is those bonds that I treasure the most, closest to my heart. I won't let them down.
Anyway, you might want to hold off on writing and sending that message.
But why? They'll want a full update.
So give them the complete update – including these next Morganas.
Oh. That makes sense. For the radiant Emperor!
@BATTLE
Ready for the training, Kanchou?
As ready as I'll ever be. Are we starting out with practice swords?
Invisible swords, to be more exact. We can wait on giving you weapons until a later point.
Huh? But how am I supposed to fight without a weapon?
Your body itself is a weapon. I prefer to hold a sword, true, but unarmed combat is also vital.
And we're doing that first?
Of course. In the heat of battle, in the case that you lose your weapon, your body is the last line of defense.
That makes sense. Not that it makes things any easier.
What would be the point if it were easy?
Never mind.
So, are you ready to begin? Get ready to defend yourself.

Fields.MenuText: Shouldn't we go over the basics of fighting before I actually fight?
I guess the same goes for you. It's your ship body that counts the most in a fight.
Okay, I'm ready. Don't hurt me too badly, please?

Fields.DialogueText: We will, after the first session. Before that, I want to see how your reflexes work.
An astute observation. But let us first focus on the looming fight.
Don't worry. Since I won't be using my sword, they'll just be minor bruises. I think.
Here I come!
Gah! ... Um, look behind you?
That old trick? But I have to commend you, very few people remember to use their wits as a weapon in unarmed martial fighting.
No, really. Look over there.
I see. You'd better arm yourself, Kanchou. We're in for a long fight this time.
@BATTLE
That's not too reassuring, Hiei.
Hiei, where are – oh, I'm sorry!
It's okay. I was almost finished meditating anyway.
Enjoying it? It must be rather relaxing.
That's one way to look at it, but it also requires strict discipline to be effective.
What are you trying to achieve with it?
In that short run, it serves to focus my mind during battle.
That makes sense.
In the long run, I wish to become one with the truth of the world and find absolution.
More of this "letting go" business?
Exactly. The world we live in is an imperfect illusion. As long as we anchor ourselves to it, we will never reach the true void.

Fields.MenuText: Doesn't tension get in the way of meditation, though?
I kind of like this world as it is.
Meditation sounds pretty complicated.

Fields.DialogueText: That is one of the paradoxes we must resolve to get to the heart of existence.
... So do I.
It's actually rather simple. Just be yourself and open your heart to enlightenment.
Anyway, I realized that we should add meditation to your training regimen.
That sounds good. The tricky part is finding a place where we won't get distracted.
You have a good point. It's tough to find anywhere on board that doesn't have someone scurrying by now and then.
Yeah, and that's leaving aside the Morganas, like now!
@BATTLE
You make it sound so easy.
Hiei? We need to talk.
Can it wait? I am kind of busy with the training work here. And then I want to check on our supplies...
That's what I wanted to talk to you about. Remember how we talked a while back about your use of free time?
I do. I explained that I take my time off doing what I like – which is being helpful.
I know. The thing is, are you relaxing when you have your "free time"?
Well, I find it rather therapeutic.
Hiei, when I asked if meditation was good for relaxation, you focused on the work side of things.
So what do you want me to do?
I don't know, just... find something new to occupy your time, some kind of hobby.
But everyone is counting on me to do my best. I cannot afford to let my guard down.

Fields.MenuText: Think of this as taking the time to stop and smell the flowers in life.
I'm mostly worried that you're doing everything for other people, and not for yourself. It's okay to be selfish now and then.
I want you to have something else you can do that makes you happy after the war ends.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right... I want to enjoy the beauty of the world, even if it is a temptation.
I told you, I do this because I like it.
I'll be okay. I did okay after the last war. Still, I wonder...
I'm kind of torn on this...
Look, the use of breaks is meant to give you separation from your work. If you treat them the same, I'm worried about the psychological effects.
But what can I do?
Who knows? That's up to you. Maybe... try something unusual, something that you just do because it sounds like fun.
Hmm... I'll have to think about that. For now, though, it's back to work.
Yeah, these Morganas never give us a break.
@BATTLE
And yet, I think that the reason you like it is because it's fulfilling your purpose in serving others.
And what's wrong with that?
Um, Hiei?
Yes, Kanchou?
Do you know why there are trees in the middle of the deck?
I was just following up on your suggestion.
My what?
You see, it's always been my wish to hike through the forests of Hiei – and Japan in general. I thought about replicating it here, but I thought it would be a little over the top.
You think?
But then, when you suggested I just go with my gut to have fun, I decided to actually go through with the idea.
I'm a little worried about them getting in the way...
I know, but... could you please honor this one selfish request?

Fields.MenuText: Do you think the trees will be okay out here?
Well, I said you should get a hobby. So no harm done.
Glad to see you're trying something new, even if it's a little outrageous.

Fields.DialogueText: I believe so. These are of the hardy mountain stock. A little sea air won't knock them out that easily.
Arigatō! I'm really happy about this.
Yes. I'm still a little nervous about doing something like this, but it's actually kind of exhilarating, like a battle!
Okay, you can keep them.
Great! Now let's get on with our hike.
"Our" hike?
It will be good exercise for you.
I thought this was free time?
It is for me. As for you, you need to go through the regimen first.
All right, let's go. But first, let's make sure these Morganas don't get any breaks.
@BATTLE
One step forward, one step back...
Eek!
What's wrong, Hiei? Are we under attack?
There's a rat in here! See?!
Oh, yeah. Big fella, huh?
Don't just stand there! We need to attack before it's too late! Attack, attack!
Okay, take it easy! It scurried out the door, if it makes you feel any better.
It didn't go after any of the books, did it?
Um... no. What, you were terrified that the rodents would turn into bookworms?
I've just always been a little wary of rats, ever since I heard the story of Tesso.
Tesso?
In life, he was a Buddhist monk that prayed for the Emperor to have a son. But he was betrayed by our temple on Mount Hiei, and he turned into a monster.
A rat, I take it.
Exactly. He was stopped before he reached the mountain, but some say that his spirit still lives on, seeking revenge.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think a book-eating monster is too high on our danger list.
Don't worry. Together, we'll teach that monster not to mess with us.
I guess your home temple's not so perfect, then.

Fields.DialogueText: More is at risk than simply the library. He also cursed multiple people. Having it aboard is a bad omen.
You're right. We've held our ground against the Morganas, and those are even worse yokai.
It was a human mistake of ambition and jealousy. We have to move past those ills and continue to seek harmony.
Well, I'm pretty sure that rat was not your Tesso.
That's good. I was worried he might hold a grudge.
Save your concerns for the enemies that matter – like the Morganas, for instance.
I knew that creature was bad luck...
@BATTLE
Given how they tend to spread disease, you might be right.
First trees, and now flowers. You're practically making the ship into a garden.
Don't worry, it won't get to that point. I prefer giving the ship a more rugged field like the wilds of the mountains.
That fails to reassure me. Those are lotuses, right?
They are indeed. Just a little tribute to the Enryaku-ji Monastery.
That's the Buddhist sect on your mountain, right?
Right. To be more precise, we are of the Tendai sect.
Interesting. What sets them apart from the rest?
Our determination to not be separated.
Huh? You'll have to be a little clearer.
Our philosophy is that all philosophies are a part of the way of the Buddha. We simply have to be accepting and find the links that tie us together.
That's pretty interesting. It must be great traveling the world, then. You get to see all sorts of new places and learn new things.
Indeed, I have. I am starting to assemble a library for the teachings I have gathered along the way. Nowhere as grand as the one on the mountain, of course, but still a humble gesture.

Fields.MenuText: Does the tolerance extend to everything beyond Buddhism, or only certain things?
What does the lotus represent?
For someone who says that everything is connected, you seem to like disconnecting yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: That's hard to say. The founders mainly had to address the local Shinto traditions. But I believe that all faiths link back to the Buddha's teachings.
It symbolizes the Lotus Sutra, but it has a lot of different angles of symbolism, just like our faith.
To understand everything is to be a part of nothing.
Well, I'll leave you to your gardening, then.
Actually, I was going to meditate. It helps get me ready for the looming battles.
Good thing, because here comes one now!
@BATTLE
I'm afraid I still don't understand.
Don't worry, I'm still working it out myself.
Hiei, where are you?
I'm in here, if you need me.
Sorry to bother you. I just wanted to go over our tactics... Is that a painting?
It will be when I'm finished with it. Why do you ask?
No reason. I was just a little surprised. I didn't know you were interested in art.
A little. I'm trying out the Impressionist style.
Isn't that French, though?
It is. A few Frenchmen have settled down on the mountain during the peacetime, so I became a little curious.
How's the painting coming along, in your opinion?
I can't really say. I'm used to the traditional style of my home, so this is a new experience. What do you think of it?

Fields.MenuText: It looks magnificent.
Not bad for your first time.
I think it reflects your style – part of the world, yet not at the same time.

Fields.DialogueText: You're giving me too much credit, but I'm glad that you enjoy it.
That's good to hear. I just have to keep working at it.
I'm glad. That mix of realism and abstractness is what attracted me to the style.
So you're happy doing this?
I'd say so. It does relax me, now and then.
Good. I'm happy that you're finding ways to relax during your free time.
Well, I still get kind of anxious, not having any work to do.
Don't worry. That dilemma is going to get solved for you in just a minute.
@BATTLE
Mm, do I smell something cooking in here?
Oh, Kanchou! I was preparing some food for the troops.
What are you making?
Tofu! It's a traditional course back in Kyoto and on the mountain.
With all the monks, I can see why. But I have to ask you something.
Yes?
Is that pot supposed to be smoking like that?
Oh no! It's burning!
Well, practice makes perfect.
Still, this is why I prefer to stick with the soldier work. At least then, I know what I am doing.

Fields.MenuText: The food isn't that burnt. We can still have it.
Still, it was brave of you to try, even when you weren't sure how to do it right.
That makes it all the more important for you to learn these things.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. Actually, the fire might have made it better, in my opinion.
The sentiment is appreciated. I need to always move forward and never surrender.
I know. Sometimes I get discouraged, but I need to keep trying to understand the world and reach enlightenment.
Maybe I'll make a new style with just burnt foods. Suits my style.
Well, if it works for you...
So, want to try some?
I'll have to pass for now – we have Morganas to tenderize.
@BATTLE
We got that one! This is good training!
Good work out there. We're almost done with this batch here, and then...
*ALARM*
Oh, no, not more...
This one looks especially powerful. Be on guard.
Too bad these things never accept surrender.
I would never give up either way. When there is a threat to the world, a warrior must never falter in destroying it.
That sounds brutal when you say it like that.
Death is part of life's cycle. There must be destruction for life to continue.
I see. That philosophy suits you well as a soldier.
It does. It helps me prepare for the end and know that, live or die, I will contribute to the growth of the world, however little.
Enough philosophy, though. Right now, we need to get out of this mess.
You are exactly right. What are your orders, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: Team up with the other ships for a coordinated assault.
Hit them from long range.
Close in on them so you can show your true power as a samurai.

Fields.DialogueText: Understood. I work better alone, but the challenge will keep things interesting.
Excellent idea. Time to put these cherished upgrades to good use.
I was hoping you would say that. My swords and fists pulse with anticipation.
Enough talk. We have no time to waste. Move out!
You heard the kanchou. Let us fight and die like pure snow on a spring mountain!
More than that, let's fight to live on another day!
@BATTLE
Ooh! This one's a beauty.
What are you looking at, Hiei?
Oh, nothing important!
Ah, I see – chopsticks. Were you planning to have lunch?
You know I abhor eating unnecessarily.
In that case, what are they for?
I was... collecting them.
Huh?
I find the simplistic artistry put into each pair to be beautiful, and I have started making a collection of them.
That's... interesting.
It's kind of silly, isn't it? But it's something unique that I enjoy, as long as I don't waste too much time with it.

Fields.MenuText: I've heard that if you can separate a pair perfectly, good luck will come to you.
I didn't know there was much difference between individual chopsticks.
Isn't it kind of difficult to look after them?

Fields.DialogueText: I know. That's what led me to gather them at the beginning. Now, though, I can't bear to potentially damage them.
You have to look very carefully, but study hard enough, and you can even understand the hearts of their makers.
It is. Their fragility and largely-wooden composition have been troublesome. Even so, I will do my best to protect them.
If you save all of the chopsticks, though, how do you eat?
I know how to use a knife and fork, like Westerners do, so I've made do.
Well, if I find any interesting chopsticks, I will be sure to inform you.
Please do.
For now, let's add a couple more ships to our collection of destroyed Morganas.
@BATTLE
That's you all right.
Um, Hiei, what is with all this old wood and dirt? More gardening?
This? Yes. It's for some horticultural work I have planned.
Ah... what are you growing now?
Fungi.
Mushrooms? That makes sense. I've been told that the wild mushrooms in Japan are very tasty.
The mountain ones certainly are. Though I'm growing more than just those kinds of mushrooms.
What do you mean?
I am trying to set up conditions to spawn various forms of fungi in general. They will give the ship an earthier feel.
Earthier is one word for it.
Don't worry, everything will be fine. Just be careful which ones you try to eat, okay?

Fields.MenuText: If you're not careful, someone will take a bite by accident.
I guess it will make for some unique décor.
Just as long as you know which ones are safe. That way we can have an emergency supply.

Fields.DialogueText: Good point. I forget that the world is full of fools and inconsiderate oafs who just eat anything without permission.
That's my hope. The different types of fungi look pretty interesting and unusual.
Of course, it is always important for warriors to keep provisions handy.
Okay, you can grow the mushrooms and the other stuff. There's no way I can say no to that smile.
Arigatō. It's just... it feels more and more like home here.
Let's do our best to keep it safe, then.
As always, I will fight to the end.
@BATTLE
I see that you're reading the newspaper, Hiei. Mind if I borrow it when you're finished, please?
Of course. It will be a little wrinkled by that point, though.
Hey, why are you crumpling it up like that?
For this. Ha!
Ow! That hurt... how'd a little bit of paper bruise me like that?
It is a matter of spiritual strength. And, it is the next lesson in your training.
Do you think I will be able to master it?
A nun, with no combat experience, was able to fend off an attacker in such a manner. I have full confidence in you.
Okay, but a little bit of instruction would help.
I am afraid that I cannot help you there. It is the heart sword, and all hearts are intrinsically different.

Fields.MenuText: How do you expect me to get anywhere, then?
Even when strengthened, will a paper sword make a difference in battle?
I will meditate and surely find an answer to the challenge.

Fields.DialogueText: Through strength in the soul, one can achieve anything.
Everything has its impact on the world. Moreover, this is the first step to becoming a true warrior.
Good. Do so, and you will learn to know yourself and the world.
Couldn't you have waited until I got a chance to read the paper myself, though?
I apologize for the rudeness, but I needed to test your reflexes.
Of course... but let me read the next one before you do something like that, okay?
I promise.
Thanks. I wonder what the news will be in the next issue.
The next headline will feature our sinking of some other Funayūrei, I know it.
@BATTLE
Ichi, ni, san, shi! Ichi, ni, san, shi!
Are you all right, Hiei?
I'm fine. I was just going on a hike around the ship.
I was just a little concerned since your overall pattern was clockwise, which you said was bad.
I was? I didn't notice that, since I was covering the full length of the ship.
Well, if you didn't notice, I guess it's nothing.
No, it must be a sign of trouble to come.
Maybe you are looking at things too hard. Relax a little.
But I need to focus if I want to fulfill my role as a sword for my country.
You're more than a sword, Hiei. You don't need to be so hard on yourself.
But I cannot allow myself to fail. If I cannot protect Japan, my dereliction of duty will be unforgivable.
Who won't forgive? You?
If I forgive myself of such sins, how will I ever find meaning?

Fields.MenuText: Sometimes you try so hard that you miss what you're looking for.
What if your destiny isn't necessarily on the battlefield – at least not entirely?
I forgive you. Can't you forgive yourself as well?

Fields.DialogueText: You might be right. Sometimes I get so caught up on things, I forget to appreciate life, for better or for worse.
Inconceivable! I was created as a successor to the ironclad Hiei, and my name is forged in fire. My existence is to fight and die. I just hope I can make the most of that purpose.
You are too kind sometimes, Kanchou.
Anyway, mind if I walk with you? It might help you calm down.
Arigatō, Kanchou.
Don't mention it. What are friends for? I just hope you can find happiness. Whatever way works best for you.
So do I.
Well, if you want to find use as a soldier, you won't have to look far. The Morganas are swarming like sharks for the kill.
@BATTLE
We appear to be turning them back. Let us fight fiercely until the end!
@BATTLE
Good, we made it through another gauntlet of Morganas. How are you doing, Hiei?
Me? I'm... fine, I guess. Just thinking about things.
Okay. If you need anything, I'm here.
Actually, could we talk?
Sure. Go right ahead. I'm here for you.
Arigatō. It's just... I've been contemplating the path I want in life, and now, I'm not entirely sure.
I thought that might be what's bothering you. So where do you want to go with things?
I want to break free of attachments to find enlightenment, but I've realized that in the process, I may have become too fixated on other things. That's where I need you.
Me?
Right. I've... always found it hard to connect with people, both in battle and outside. Partially my choice. But I think, working with you, I can understand the world better. Can you help me?

Fields.MenuText: We can help each other. That's what friends do.
I promise that I'll do everything I can to help you find happiness.
